item.title: Smiling like a madman
item.description:
First I was innocent,
I asked for an identity,
The world pushed me down and pained me.
I talked to the world about this pain,
And the world mocked me.


I felt alone in this fight,
I wanted to run away.
But, she didn't let me.
She made me break into a thousand pieces,
But always took great care that none was lost.
And when I gave up,
She made me work on myself.
And That's how I recollected myself to be wholler than the whole.


-------------------------------xx-------------------------------


Second, I now had an identity.
She pushed me to limelight,
Then the eyes of the world fixated at me pained me.
Their dreams, their expectations,
Them trying to fulfill their dreams through me.
I again talked to the world about the burden of expectations,
And the world really didn't care.

I felt alone again in this fight,
I wanted to run away.
But, she didn't let me.
She made me take even more burden until I broke again,
Yet she took great care again that none was lost.
And when I gave up,
She made me work on myself.
And thats how I recollected myself to be wholler than the whole again.


-------------------------------xx-------------------------------


Third, I now was strong enough to take any burden.
She pushed me to search for truth,
I started wandering here and there in search of truth,
The words from thousand masters buzzed like a bomb inside my head.
But by now, I knew the world never listened.
I chose a few,
Tried telling them the never ending search,
Yet they too didn’t get much.

item.title: On Love
item.description: I have been trying to write some essays on basic words that are the hardest to capture because often times it’s these words that stir up conflict: love, happiness, fulfillment, peace, pain, god, spirituality etc. Because they are the most overused, yet least understood by our subconscious minds, our subconscious gets trippy while making sense. I started writing this essay about six months ago. In trying to write this essay, I started by searching for word love in my personal notes vault. It got overwhelming even after a day digesting, that I gave up the pursuit for some time. I really didn’t have any digest apart from notes and excerpts from others. I knew where to start, but couldn’t end it.
